title: Multiparametric MRI radiomics predicts neoadjuvant response in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma
authors: Li H; Zhang Q; Chen Y
key_findings: Baseline multiparametric radiomics combined with clinical stage improved prediction of pathologic complete response to chemoradiotherapy.

title: Deep learning fusion of CT and MRI for cT staging in esophageal adenocarcinoma
authors: Garcia M; Khan S; Patel R
key_findings: Cross-modality attention network reduced staging errors versus radiologist assessment by 18%.

title: Biomechanics-informed radiomics for esophageal wall infiltration assessment
authors: Rossi F; Kim S; Zhao X
key_findings: Coupling finite-element deformation priors with CT radiomics enhanced invasion depth estimation.

title: Quantitative diffusion MRI biomarkers for adaptive chemoradiotherapy in esophageal cancer
authors: Miller T; Amano H; Wu Y
journal: International Journal of Radiation Oncology Biology Physics
key_findings: Early diffusion coefficient shifts predicted locoregional control and guided adaptive boosting.

title: Integrated PET/MR for immunotherapy response evaluation in metastatic esophageal cancer
authors: Zhou L; Martins R; Nguyen T
key_findings: Hybrid metabolic-radiomic signatures anticipated immunotherapy benefit in 78% of responders.

title: Hybrid MRI-CT radiomics nomogram for recurrence risk in locally advanced esophageal cancer
authors: Wang L; Sun P; Huang J
key_findings: Combined MRI texture and CT shape descriptors improved recurrence prediction AUC to 0.87.

title: Transformer-based multimodal imaging model for esophageal cancer survival
key_findings: Temporal fusion of longitudinal CT and MRI scans outperformed Cox baselines by 9% C-index.

title: Federated learning of cross-hospital esophageal cancer imaging
authors: Zhang Y; Delingette H; Liu J
key_findings: Secure aggregation of 7 hospitals yielded robust staging models without data centralization.

title: Graph neural networks integrating endoscopy and imaging for esophageal cancer
authors: Hernandez D; Wu L; Kawano T
key_findings: Multimodal graph fusion improved nodal staging accuracy by 12 percentage points.

title: Self-supervised contrastive learning for low-resource esophageal MRI
key_findings: Contrastive pretraining boosted downstream segmentation Dice by 7% on limited labels.
